basis: User explicitly commits to starting today with Day 1 prompts, rotating to Day 2 tomorrow, logging key data, and retaining fixed reminders. Tone is positive and action-oriented with clear next steps.
cognitive_dissonance: Tension between a strong intention to adhere under stress and anxiety about sticking to the protocol during busy or high-workload moments.
negative_thought_patterns: All-or-nothing thinking about adherence; worry of failure under pressure; self-doubt about being able to maintain routine at work.
emotional_triggers: Work-related stress, time pressure, distractions, craving spikes during busy shifts.
coaching_notes: Keep prompts concise for workdays; reinforce the value of micro-steps (1-minute wait, breaths, water). Acknowledge progress and provide easy fallbacks (e.g., brief outside time or 5-minute walk). Consider adding ultra-simple contingency prompts for peak stress periods to reduce drop-off.
